Ascending the Chain.name: Ascending the Chain
Ascending the Chain.descriptionHazard: The PCs appear on a gigantic wall of hooked chains dangling in a gray swirling mist. The chains radiate life-chilling energy Cries of innocence and condemnation echo through the mist in Elven. A plane of light 10 feet above eddies and swirls as it dully reflects the PCs below, but the reflections warp and alter the PCs to have sallow complexions like the undead.
Ascending the Chain.disable: A PC that has ascended to the plane of light (@Check[athletics|dc:15] check to Climb; on a critical failure, the PC falls 10 feet before being seized by a chain) can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:20] check to disrupt the plane or a @Check[arcana|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20] or @Check[religion|dc:20] check to ritually disrupt the haunting. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one. When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled and the PCs all return to area B3.
Ascending the Chain.reset: The haunt resets the next time the Soulshackle traps creatures in the library.
Ascending the Chain.routine: (three actions) The chains rattle and sigh ominously around two different random creatures trapped in the haunt, dealing @Damage[(2d6+2)[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:18|basic] save).

action->The Pain of Devotion.name: The Pain of Devotion
action->The Pain of Devotion.description:
Trigger Hunted by Chains is disabled

Effect The chains rattle ominously, dealing @Damage[(2d6+2)[void]] damage to all creatures in the haunt (@Check[will|dc:18|basic] save). The haunt then rolls initiative.

Athamaru Pirate.name: Athamaru Pirate
Athamaru Pirate.publicNotes:
Deep in the sea, schools of athamarus—piscine humanoids armed with spears and specialized crossbows—stalk sharks, sea serpents, and giant squid from the backs of their giant moray eel mounts. The first hunters to strike are armed with barbed harpoons that deploy large fans of seaweed, slowing and exhausting their prey. A daring few athamarus use the embedded harpoon as a handle to ride prey for a short time. Once the creature is tired, remaining hunters finish it with longspears. Athamarus developed this hunting tradition to forge skilled warriors and deter potential attackers, partially in response to centuries of oppression and mistreatment from other aquatic cultures.

Athamarus rarely hunt land-dwellers, instead offering to trade their services as guides in exchange for metal and ceramic items they can't build underwater—and for tubers, which they consider earthy delicacies. They render aid to damaged sailing ships and rescue shipwrecked sailors, providing food and guidance.

Athamaru communities—usually villages of 200 individuals or fewer—are matriarchal. The ruler of a given community is also the primary egg-layer, providing each generation with powerful familial bonds. The communities are tight-knit and loyal. Matriarchs are advised and assisted by primal spellcasters and healers.

ammo->Fan Bolts.name: Fan Bolts
ammo->Fan Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Diving Reload.name: Diving Reload
action->Diving Reload.description: The athamaru pirate can dive underwater, giving them concealment, and reload in the same action.

action->Fan Bolt.name: Fan Bolt
action->Fan Bolt.description:
The athamaru pirate prepares their hooked crossbow bolts with carefully woven seaweed. On a successful crossbow Strike, the bolt embeds and the seaweed fan deploys. The target takes a –10-foot status penalty to its swim Speed. A creature can Interact to attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:18] check, removing the bolt on a success.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.seWuw1GMSm3kzCWV]{Effect: Fan Bolt}

action->Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
action->Hunt Prey.description: The athamaru pirate designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The athamaru pirate gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the athamaru pirate hits their designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. These effects last until the pirate uses Hunt Prey again.

action->Smooth Swimmer.name: Smooth Swimmer
action->Smooth Swimmer.description: The athamaru pirate ignores difficult terrain caused by aquatic terrain features.

action->Retributive Strike.name: Retributive Strike
action->Retributive Strike.description:
Trigger An enemy damages Bartolo's ally, and both are within 15 feet of him

Effect Bartolo protects his ally and strikes his foe. The ally gains resistance 3 to all damage against the triggering damage. If the foe is within reach, Bartolo makes a melee Strike against it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.DawVHfoPKbPJsz4k]{Effect: Champion's Resistance}

action->Living Shield.name: Living Shield
action->Living Shield.description: Bartolo grapples a creature and uses it as a shield, gaining +2 to his AC and the Shield Block reaction while the target is grappled. Use the creature's level plus item bonus to AC (if any) as its Hardness.

action->Retributive Strike.name: Retributive Strike
action->Retributive Strike.description:
Trigger An enemy damages Bartolo's ally, and both are within 15 feet of him

Effect Bartolo protects his ally and strikes his foe The ally gains resistance 5 to all damage against the triggering damage If the foe is within reach, Bartolo makes a melee Strike against it

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.DawVHfoPKbPJsz4k]{Effect: Champion's Resistance}

action->Living Shield.name: Living Shield
action->Living Shield.description: Bartolo grapples a creature and uses it as a shield, gaining +2 to his AC and the Shield Block reaction while the target is grappled. Use the creature's level plus item bonus to AC (if any) as its Hardness.

Bubbling Pile of Orts.name: Bubbling Pile of Orts
Bubbling Pile of Orts.descriptionHazard: A rift to Hell crackles with unstable energy from the broken summoning circle as a squirming mass of fiends struggles to emerge A blood mist projection of a Hellknight angrily commands them.
Bubbling Pile of Orts.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:19], @Check[nature|dc:19], @Check[occultism|dc:19], or @Check[religion|dc:19] (2 actions) (trained) while within 15 feet to weaken the rift, dealing @Damage[3d4[spirit]|traits:holy] damage to it. This damage has the holy trait.
Bubbling Pile of Orts.routine: (1 action) The Hellknight commands the orts, and the trap lashes out at each enemy creature in its space and adjacent, dealing @Damage[(1d10+6)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save) If no enemy is in reach, an ort emerges in an adjacent square.

action->Hellfire.name: Hellfire
action->Hellfire.description: All orts within 30 feet have +1 status bonus to hit and deal 1d4 extra fire damage on a hit.

action->Bubble.name: Bubble
action->Bubble.description:
Trigger The trap receives a critical hit or critically fails a saving throw

Effect One ort emerges adjacent.

action->Planar Breach.name: Planar Breach
action->Planar Breach.description:
Trigger The magic circle is broken

Effect The pile disgorges orts and then rolls initiative.

Captain Conziva.name: Captain Conziva
Captain Conziva.publicNotes:
A ship's boatswain, or bosun, leads the deckhands who maintain the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

weapon->Naval Pike.name: Naval Pike
weapon->Naval Pike.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

action->Captain's Command.name: Captain's Command
action->Captain's Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Captain Conziva orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the captain's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.WfiaKdXNSxC3POcs]{Effect: Bosun's Command}

action->Pike and Strike.name: Pike and Strike
action->Pike and Strike.description: Captain Conziva Strikes with her naval pike. If this Strike hits, the captain can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a claw Strike against the target without increasing her multiple attack penalty until after the claw Strike.

Damaged Jaws of Hell.name: Damaged Jaws of Hell
Damaged Jaws of Hell.descriptionHazard: The machine is a cylindrical device ringed in blades with a devilish eye at its center. Gnome inventors created the mechanical device, which taps into the planes of earth and fre to create powerful blasts to damage fortress walls or decimate ranks of enemies. Unfortunately, the many miles of forest have not been kind and it's malfunctioning. The damaged jaws planar connections have weakened to a mere trickle and, when activated, it lashes out in an uncontrolled frenzy. The blades encircling it begin lashing out.
Damaged Jaws of Hell.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[crafting|dc:18], @Check[nature|dc:18], or @Check[thievery|dc:18] (trained) twice, to sever the connection to the planes of fre and earth. @Check[crafting|dc:16] or @Check[thievery|dc:16] (trained) once, to remove the pintle connecting the limber to the horses. A creature must be adjacent to the jaws to make either check.
Damaged Jaws of Hell.reset: The planar connection shuts down after 1 minute. The horses will tire and stop running after 1 minute.
Damaged Jaws of Hell.routine: (three actions) On its turn each round, the horses spend one action to move 30 feet, dragging the limber carrying the jaws behind them in a randomly chosen direction. The horses will not move through other creatures. Players on the limber when it moves must attempt a @Check[acrobatics|dc:18] check when it moves or fall of. Removing the pintle will end the random movement. The jaws use 2 actions to Spit Fire or make melee strikes against an adjacent creature.

action->Blades of Vengeance.name: Blades of Vengeance
action->Blades of Vengeance.description:
Trigger A Small or larger creature, moves within 10 feet of the jaws.

Effect One of the blades lashes out, making one Strike against the creature.

action->Spit Fire.name: Spit Fire
action->Spit Fire.description:
The jaws launch a magma ball (range 60 feet, @Template[burst|distance:10]), randomly, at the largest group of creatures, not including itself, it can catch in the blast dealing @Damage[3d4[bludgeoning],3d4[fire]|options:area-damage] damage. Each creature caught in the blast must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18|options:damaging-effect,area-effect] save. The jaws cannot Spit Fire again for [[/gmr 1d4+1 #Recharge Spit Fire]] rounds.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, @Damage[1[persistent,fire]] damage, and is knocked prone.

Demonologist.name: Demonologist
Demonologist.publicNotes:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Outer Rifts and bend it to their will... for a time.

Hidden secrets and occult powers have an irresistible lure for many. Since the majority of these NPCs are spellcasters, consider using alternative spell lists to adjust their themes.

armor->Robes.name: Robes
armor->Robes.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

equipment->Fiendish Hypotheses and Prote.name: Fiendish Hypotheses and Protections from Same (Spellbook)
equipment->Fiendish Hypotheses and Prote.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

action->Demonic Temptation.name: Demonic Temptation
action->Demonic Temptation.description: Demonic study has garnered the attention of at least one demon who is actively trying to possess the demonologist. When the demonologist publicly espouses the benefits of demonic power (whether they believe it a good thing or not), they gain a +1 status bonus to skill checks, AC, and saves for 1 day. These bonuses don't apply against demons. At the end of the day, the demonologist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save, becoming possessed for 1 day on a failure (or permanently on a critical failure).

action->Breach the Outer Rifts.name: Breach the Outer Rifts
action->Breach the Outer Rifts.description:
Requirements The demonologist's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The demonologist siphons energy drawn from the Outer Rifts into their weapon. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage.

Roll 1d20 to determine the type:

  • 1–7 acid
  • 8–9 cold
  • 10–11 electricity
  • 12–18 fire
  • 19–20 void.

action->Demon Summoning.name: Demon Summoning
action->Demon Summoning.description: The demonologist can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core-2.Actor.ANptV6ltBi9C3P1l]{Nucol}. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[mental]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the demonologist is unable to Sustain the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure.

equipment->Clothing (Fine).name: Clothing (Fine)
equipment->Clothing (Fine).description: Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns.

action->Hidden Blade.name: Hidden Blade
action->Hidden Blade.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The diabolic messenger draws a weapon and then Strikes with it The target of the Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The diabolic messenger deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Distracted Zaluraak.name: Distracted Zaluraak
Distracted Zaluraak.publicNotes:
Fortune dragons have the innate ability to draw upon the raw magical energies that surround them. They constantly use these magical energies to empower their magical abilities and even their bodies, as the energy can heal wounds. A fortune dragon has a typical build for an arcane dragon, but their bodies sport a striking feature: their treasure. The dragon's nature of drawing upon magic causes coins, gems, and, most notably, magical items to cling to their body like iron drawn to magnets. A dragon constantly pulls magical energies from the items attached to their body and makes use of these energies to cast spells. The magical energies that flow through a fortune dragon constantly flow through the dragon's items as well, and in many cases, the items melt from the heat produced in this process. Fortune dragons are seekers of novel experiences. This desire for originality leads fortune dragons to approach visitors of other ancestries with curiosity, though this initial interest quickly wanes if a visitor lacks exciting qualities.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Distracted Zaluraak.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. arcane

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcan.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

action->Capture Spell.name: Capture Spell
action->Capture Spell.description:
Trigger The dragon succeeds or critically succeeds on a saving throw against a spell

Effect The dragon attempts to capture a portion of the spell's magic to feed themself. They attempt to counteract the spell (counteract rank 5, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+20 #Counteract]]{+20}). If successful, the dragon is unaffected by the spell and regains one expended spontaneous spell slot; other subjects are affected by the spell normally.

action->Disruptive Breath.name: Disruptive Breath
action->Disruptive Breath.description:
The dragon unleashes a spray of magic-disrupting energies that deals @Damage[7d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.

The dragon can't use Disruptive Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Disruptive Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: Whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike, the dragon chooses to either recharge Disruptive Breath or regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

action->Share the Wealth.name: Share the Wealth
action->Share the Wealth.description:
Requirements The dragon's body is covered in riches (this is typically the case when the dragon is first encountered)

Effect The dragon shakes their body aggressively, sending coins and other riches flying in every direction, dealing @Damage[7d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. The dragon's body is then no longer covered in riches.

action->Treasure Dive.name: Treasure Dive
action->Treasure Dive.description:
Requirements The dragon's body isn't covered in riches and the dragon is adjacent to their hoard

Effect The dragon Strides or Burrows through their hoard using their land Speed. They coat themself in coins, magic items, and other treasures. This contact with magical items revitalizes the dragon, causing them to regain one expended spontaneous spell slot.

The dragon can move through other creatures while moving in this way. Creatures in the dragon's path, or above it if the dragon Burrows, must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or be pushed 10 feet (or pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure).

Dragged to the Briny Depths.name: Dragged to the Briny Depths
Dragged to the Briny Depths.descriptionHazard: A giant squid rams the ship from below, using its beak to puncture the hull. It then wraps its tentacles around the mast, rocking the ship violently.
Dragged to the Briny Depths.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:23] to pull the tentacles from the mast, stopping the ship from rocking; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Dragged to the Briny Depths.reset: The squid releases the ship for one round before regripping the mast and resetting the hazard The hazard no longer resets once the PCs defeat the naiads or they flee
Dragged to the Briny Depths.routine: (two actions) On its initiative, the squid uses its first action to pull on the mast Every creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save On a failure, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} If a creature is prone when attempting the save, it slides 10 feet in a direction determined by the GM on a failure If this movement would force a creature off the ship, it can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} The squid uses its second action to make one tentacle attack

action->Flip the Ship.name: Flip the Ship
action->Flip the Ship.description:
Trigger The naiads board the ship

Effect Each creature standing on the deck must attempt a @Check[Refex|dc:22] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Dragged to the Depths.name: Dragged to the Depths
Dragged to the Depths.descriptionHazard: A giant squid rams the ship from below, using its beak to puncture the hull. It then wraps its tentacles around the mast, rocking the ship violently.
Dragged to the Depths.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:20] to pull the tentacles from the mast, stopping the ship from rocking; two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Dragged to the Depths.reset: The squid releases the ship for one round before regripping the mast and resetting the hazard The hazard no longer resets once the PCs defeat the naiads or they flee
Dragged to the Depths.routine: (two actions) On its initiative, the squid uses its first action to pull on the mast Every creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save On a failure, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} If a creature is prone when attempting the save, it slides 10 feet in a direction determined by the GM on a failure If this movement would force a creature off the ship, it can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} The squid uses its second action to make one tentacle attack

action->Flip the Ship.name: Flip the Ship
action->Flip the Ship.description:
Trigger The naiads board the ship

Effect Each creature standing on the deck must attempt a @Check[Refex|dc:20] save or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Dragon's Ward.name: Dragon's Ward
Dragon's Ward.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:27] (master) to painstakingly remove the rune without triggering the magic, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 25) to counteract the rune.

action->Curse the Intruders.name: Curse the Intruders
action->Curse the Intruders.description:
Trigger A creature passes the threshold

Effect Each living creature within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:23] save or be subjected to the dragon's curse A cursed creature takes a –2 status penalty to Fortitude saves, and any natural or magical healing it receives is halved The curse remains until removed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} or similar magic

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qPul8V5LMyHNpsOa]{Effect: Curse the Intruders}

Duty's Soulshackle.name: Duty's Soulshackle
Duty's Soulshackle.descriptionHazard: A length of humanoid spine is held into a staff by the hooked chain embedded in and entwined around it. Additional spectral chains of pure shadowstuff hold it aloft and sinuously surround it.
Duty's Soulshackle.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[religion|dc:20] (trained) to disrupt the spectral energies channeled by the intelligent item. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one. When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled.
Duty's Soulshackle.routine: (three actions) On its initiative, Duty's Soulshackle first uses Call to Serve if it's able to and spends any remaining actions making velstrac chains Strikes against its enemies.
Duty's Soulshackle.stealth: (expert); noticing the staff has a DC of 0.

action->Chained by Duty.name: Chained by Duty
action->Chained by Duty.description:
Trigger Lyari proposes how to free herself from Duty's Soulshackle.

Effect Duty's Soulshackle quivers in rage before unleashing more spectral chains. The haunt then rolls initiative.

action->Call to Serve.name: Call to Serve
action->Call to Serve.description: Duty's Soulshackle creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-7-bestiary.Actor.ckZ7eHNCFNP6ddiO]{Withered Leaf of Talhindir} within 10 feet of itself. It then cannot use this action for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

Duty's Soulshackle (3-4).name: Duty's Soulshackle (3-4)
Duty's Soulshackle (3-4).descriptionHazard: A length of humanoid spine is held into a staff by the hooked chain embedded in and entwined around it. Additional spectral chains of pure shadowstuff hold it aloft and sinuously surround it.
Duty's Soulshackle (3-4).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:23], @Check[occultism|dc:23], or @Check[religion|dc:23] (trained) to disrupt the spectral energies channeled by the intelligent item. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one. When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled.
Duty's Soulshackle (3-4).routine: (three actions) On its initiative, Duty's Soulshackle first uses Call to Serve if it's able to and spends any remaining actions making velstrac chains Strikes against its enemies.
Duty's Soulshackle (3-4).stealth: (expert); noticing the staff has a DC of 0.

action->Chained by Duty.name: Chained by Duty
action->Chained by Duty.description:
Trigger Lyari proposes how to free herself from Duty's Soulshackle.

Effect Duty's Soulshackle quivers in rage before unleashing more spectral chains. The haunt then rolls initiative.

action->Call to Serve.name: Call to Serve
action->Call to Serve.description: Duty's Soulshackle creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-7-bestiary.Actor.gCD8rOahd9F9ZSJO]{Shriveled Leaf of Talhindir} within 10 feet of itself. It then cannot use this action for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

Enraged Sea Life.name: Enraged Sea Life
Enraged Sea Life.descriptionHazard: A swarm of aggressive cuttlefish, octopuses, devil rays, and countless other species of sea life bite and bludgeon Timonithaea's enemies.
Enraged Sea Life.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23] (trained) to remove the crown from the altar while avoiding being bitten by the swarming sea life; or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 23) to disable the crown's enchantment, breaking Timonithaea's control over the sea creatures.
Enraged Sea Life.routine: (one action) The sea creatures attack, dealing @Damage[(1d8+3)[bludgeoning],(1d8+3)[piercing]] damage to each creature hostile to Timonithaea within the temple (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

action->Aquatic Onslaught.name: Aquatic Onslaught
action->Aquatic Onslaught.description:
Trigger The PCs enter the main temple chamber

Effect The chamber fills with sea creatures, then rolls initiative.

Frenzied Sea Life.name: Frenzied Sea Life
Frenzied Sea Life.descriptionHazard: A swarm of aggressive cuttlefish, octopuses, devil rays, and countless other species of sea life bite and bludgeon Timonithaea's enemies.
Frenzied Sea Life.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:27] (trained) to remove the crown from the altar while avoiding being bitten by the swarming sea life, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 27) to disable the crown's enchantment, breaking Timonithaea's control over the sea creatures.
Frenzied Sea Life.routine: (one action) The sea creatures attack, dealing @Damage[(1d10+4)[bludgeoning],(1d10+4)[piercing]] damage to each creature hostile to Timonithaea within the temple (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save).

action->Aquatic Onslaught.name: Aquatic Onslaught
action->Aquatic Onslaught.description:
Trigger The PCs enter the main temple chamber

Effect The chamber fills with sea creatures, then rolls initiative.

Goblin Rigger.name: Goblin Rigger
Goblin Rigger.publicNotes:
The theoretical leaders of goblin raids are called goblin commandos. In practice, goblin commandos rarely continue to lead their comrades once a battle has begun. Most shirk their responsibilities in favor of wading into the fray and claiming more glory from their tribe-mates.

These small humanoids typically have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, many are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to the rigger

Effect The goblin rigger Steps.

action->Boarding Action.name: Boarding Action
action->Boarding Action.description: The goblin rigger swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the rigger boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.

Greater Demonologist.name: Greater Demonologist
Greater Demonologist.publicNotes:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Outer Rifts and bend it to their will... for a time.

Hidden secrets and occult powers have an irresistible lure for many. Since the majority of these NPCs are spellcasters, consider using alternative spell lists to adjust their themes.

armor->Robes.name: Robes
armor->Robes.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

equipment->Fiendish Hypotheses and Prote.name: Fiendish Hypotheses and Protections from Same (Spellbook)
equipment->Fiendish Hypotheses and Prote.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

action->Demonic Temptation.name: Demonic Temptation
action->Demonic Temptation.description: Demonic study has garnered the attention of at least one demon who is actively trying to possess the demonologist. When the demonologist publicly espouses the benefits of demonic power (whether they believe it a good thing or not), they gain a +1 status bonus to skill checks, AC, and saves for 1 day. These bonuses don't apply against demons. At the end of the day, the demonologist must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save, becoming possessed for 1 day on a failure (or permanently on a critical failure).

action->Breach the Outer Rifts.name: Breach the Outer Rifts
action->Breach the Outer Rifts.description:
Requirements The demonologist's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The demonologist siphons energy drawn from the Outer Rifts into their weapon. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage.

Roll 1d20 to determine the type:

  • 1–7 acid
  • 8–9 cold
  • 10–11 electricity
  • 12–18 fire
  • 19–20 void.

action->Demon Summoning.name: Demon Summoning
action->Demon Summoning.description: The demonologist can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a demon. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[mental]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented. If the demonologist is unable to Sustain the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure.

Greater Dragon's Ward.name: Greater Dragon's Ward
Greater Dragon's Ward.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:30] (master) to painstakingly remove the rune without triggering the magic, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 28) to counteract the rune.

action->Curse the Intruders.name: Curse the Intruders
action->Curse the Intruders.description:
Trigger A creature passes the threshold

Effect Each living creature within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be subjected to the dragon's curse A cursed creature takes a –2 status penalty to Fortitude saves, and any natural or magical healing it receives is halved The curse remains until removed by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} or similar magic

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qPul8V5LMyHNpsOa]{Effect: Curse the Intruders}

Heavily Damaged Jaws of Hell.name: Heavily Damaged Jaws of Hell
Heavily Damaged Jaws of Hell.descriptionHazard: The machine is a cylindrical device ringed in blades with a devilish eye at its center. Gnome inventors created the mechanical device, which taps into the planes of earth and fre to create powerful blasts to damage fortress walls or decimate ranks of enemies. Unfortunately, the many miles of forest have not been kind and it's malfunctioning. The damaged jaws planar connections have weakened to a mere trickle and, when activated, it lashes out in an uncontrolled frenzy. The blades encircling it begin lashing out.
Heavily Damaged Jaws of Hell.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:15], @Check[crafting|dc:15], @Check[nature|dc:15], or @Check[thievery|dc:15] (trained) twice, to sever the connection to the planes of fre and earth. @Check[crafting|dc:13] or @Check[thievery|dc:13] (trained) once, to remove the pintle connecting the limber to the horses. A creature must be adjacent to the jaws to make either check.
Heavily Damaged Jaws of Hell.reset: The planar connection shuts down after 1 minute. The horses will tire and stop running after 1 minute.
Heavily Damaged Jaws of Hell.routine: (three actions) On its turn each round, the horses spend one action to move 30 feet, dragging the limber carrying the jaws behind them in a randomly chosen direction. The horses will not move through other creatures. Players on the limber when it moves must attempt a @Check[acrobatics|dc:15] check when it moves or fall of. Removing the pintle will end the random movement. The jaws use 2 actions to Spit Fire or make melee strikes against an adjacent creature.

action->Blades of Vengeance.name: Blades of Vengeance
action->Blades of Vengeance.description:
Trigger A Small or larger creature, moves within 10 feet of the jaws.

Effect One of the blades lashes out, making one Strike against the creature.

action->Spit Fire.name: Spit Fire
action->Spit Fire.description:
The jaws launch a magma ball (range 60 feet, @Template[burst|distance:10]), randomly, at the largest group of creatures, not including itself, it can catch in the blast dealing @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning],2d4[fire]|options:area-damage] damage. Each creature caught in the blast must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:15|options:damaging-effect,area-effect] save. The jaws cannot Spit Fire again for [[/gmr 1d4+1 #Recharge Spit Fire]] rounds.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, @Damage[1[persistent,fire]] damage, and is knocked prone.

Hunted by Chains.name: Hunted by Chains
Hunted by Chains.descriptionHazard: Shadowy chains reach out to ensnare creatures trapped in the mindscape.
Hunted by Chains.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:17] to avoid the chains, or @Check[arcana|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[religion|dc:17] to ritually disrupt the haunting. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one. When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled and the Scaling the Chain haunt triggers.
Hunted by Chains.reset: The haunt resets the next time the Soulshackle traps creatures in the library.
Hunted by Chains.routine: (two actions) Spectral chains snake out to wrap around three different random creatures trapped in the haunt, who must each succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save or have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} condition until it [[/act escape dc=16]]{Escapes}. Each round that a creature starts its turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, it takes @Damage[2d4[force]]{2d4 nonlethal force} damage. Spectral scars form on any creature knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} by this haunt.

action->Chains of Undeath.name: Chains of Undeath
action->Chains of Undeath.description:
Trigger Talhindir's Autumn is disabled

Effect A spectral image of Duty's Soulshackle appears in a display nook, snaking out chains of dark energy toward each creature. Each living creature in the haunt must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} The haunt then rolls initiative.

Hunted by Duty's Bonds.name: Hunted by Duty's Bonds
Hunted by Duty's Bonds.descriptionHazard: Shadowy chains reach out to ensnare creatures trapped in the mindscape.
Hunted by Duty's Bonds.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:18] to avoid the chains, or @Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18], or @Check[religion|dc:18] to ritually disrupt the haunting. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one. When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled and the Scaling the Chain haunt triggers.
Hunted by Duty's Bonds.reset: The haunt resets the next time the Soulshackle traps creatures in the library.
Hunted by Duty's Bonds.routine: (two actions) Spectral chains snake out to wrap around three different random creatures trapped in the haunt, who must each succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} condition until it [[/act escape dc=17]]{Escapes}. Each round that a creature starts its turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, it takes @Damage[(2d4+1)[force]]{2d4+1 nonlethal force} damage. Spectral scars form on any creature knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} by this haunt.

action->Chains of Undeath.name: Chains of Undeath
action->Chains of Undeath.description:
Trigger Talhindir's Autumn is disabled

Effect A spectral image of Duty's Soulshackle appears in a display nook, snaking out chains of dark energy toward each creature. Each living creature in the haunt must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} The haunt then rolls initiative.

Imp Minion.name: Imp Minion
Imp Minion.publicNotes: Imps are fiendish infiltrators and corrupters who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time. An imp will often agree to serve a mortal and act docile and loyal in a long-term plot to eventually get their master killed or damn their soul. Imps are born directly from the Outer Planes themselves, rather than from mortal souls, and thus they serve outside any fiendish hierarchies, granting them leeway to pursue their specialties. Despite standing a mere 2 feet tall, imps can be vicious combatants, flying out of reach and turning invisible to escape should the odds turn against them.

Imp Minion (3-4).name: Imp Minion (3-4)
Imp Minion (3-4).publicNotes: Imps are fiendish infiltrators and corrupters who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time. An imp will often agree to serve a mortal and act docile and loyal in a long-term plot to eventually get their master killed or damn their soul. Imps are born directly from the Outer Planes themselves, rather than from mortal souls, and thus they serve outside any fiendish hierarchies, granting them leeway to pursue their specialties. Despite standing a mere 2 feet tall, imps can be vicious combatants, flying out of reach and turning invisible to escape should the odds turn against them.

In a Pickle.name: In a Pickle
In a Pickle.descriptionHazard: A soot-blackened brazier glows with fiendish light, shadows fickering inside.
In a Pickle.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18], or @Check[religion|dc:18] while within 15 feet of the brazier to command it to stop, reducing its actions by 1 (or 2 on a critical success); @Check[thievery|dc:20] to fnd the hidden switch on the brazier that deactivates it; or 1st-rank spell, counteract DC 17, to dispel the shadow flames in one square, using any spell with the water or light traits.
In a Pickle.reset: The flames cease 1 minute after all living creatures leave the area, but after 1 hour, a well of darkness fills the brazier and it is ready to trigger again.
In a Pickle.routine: (4 actions) The trap ignites shadowy flames in a @Template[line|distance:5]{5-foot square} within the area of the room A creature that moves into or ends its turn in this fire takes @Damage[(1d6+5)[fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic]) Increase the DC by 2 if the creature is in magical darkness (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic]).

action->Flames of Caina.name: Flames of Caina
action->Flames of Caina.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the area

Effect Shadows roil in the brazier. It casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness} on itself, and then rolls initiative.

In a Right Pickle.name: In a Right Pickle
In a Right Pickle.descriptionHazard: A soot-blackened brazier glows with fiendish light, shadows fickering inside.
In a Right Pickle.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:21], @Check[occultism|dc:21], or @Check[religion|dc:21] while within 15 feet of the brazier to command it to stop, reducing its actions by 1 (or 2 on a critical success); @Check[thievery|dc:23] to find the hidden switch on the brazier that deactivates it; or 1st-rank spell, counteract DC 20, to dispel the shadow flames in one square, using any spell with the water or light traits
In a Right Pickle.reset: The flames cease 1 minute after all living creatures leave the area, but after 1 hour, a well of darkness fills the brazier and it is ready to trigger again.
In a Right Pickle.routine: (4 actions) The trap ignites shadowy flames in a @Template[line|distance:5]{5-foot square} within the area of the room. A creature that moves into or ends its turn in this fire takes @Damage[(2d6+5)[fire]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save). Increase the DC by 2 if the creature is in magical darkness (@Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic]).

action->Flames of Caina.name: Flames of Caina
action->Flames of Caina.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the area

Effect Shadows roil in the brazier. It casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness} on itself, and then rolls initiative.

King Pirate Gorilla.name: King Pirate Gorilla
King Pirate Gorilla.publicNotes:
Gorillas can be territorial creatures, particularly if provoked by hunters or the presence of more dangerous monsters. A gorilla uses its fangs and powerful arms to bite and pummel trespassers with wild abandon.

While many apes exhibit peaceful or reclusive behavior, gorillas can be territorial, and the megaprimatus is especially aggressive and dangerous.

action->Boarding Action.name: Boarding Action
action->Boarding Action.description: The pirate gorilla swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the pirate boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.

action->Frightening Display.name: Frightening Display
action->Frightening Display.description:
The gorilla beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened,inflicts:off-guard] save. While a creature is frightened by this ability, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the gorilla.

Critical Success No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

action->Well-Trained.name: Well-Trained
action->Well-Trained.description: The pirate gorilla is used to taking orders on board the ship. It loses its immunity to linguistic efects, including appeals to surrender.

Kizrech.name: Kizrech
Kizrech.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

equipment->Charm of Cold Resistance.name: Charm of Cold Resistance
equipment->Charm of Cold Resistance.description: This charm, normally hung from the belt or worn around the neck, grants you resistance 5 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each charm is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a charm of cold resistance could be carved in the shape of a yeti, whereas a charm of fire resistance would be made from volcanic glass.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Infernal Command.name: Infernal Command
action->Infernal Command.description:
Trigger An enemy within 30 feet of Kizrech damages them or their mount

Effect Kizrech commands their enemy to kneel before them. The triggering enemy must choose to either drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} as a free action or take @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

action->Mounted Force.name: Mounted Force
action->Mounted Force.description: While mounted on a fend, Kizrech's trident gains the jousting 1d8 and thrown 60 feet traits, and Kizrech and their mount each increase their level by 1 when resolving incapacitation efects.

action->Burning Hoofprints.name: Burning Hoofprints
action->Burning Hoofprints.description: Kizrech Strides, trailing hoofprints in each square they exit. The hoofprints burn for 1 minute. A creature on the ground that enters a square with burning hoofprints or begins its turn in one takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage. Kizrech can use this ability while mounted, afecting up to 30 feet of contiguous hoofprints from their mount's Stride; this trail is 10 feet wide for a Large mount, or 15 feet wide for a Huge mount.

action->Trident of Dis.name: Trident of Dis
action->Trident of Dis.description: Kizrech makes a trident Strike, increasing their reach to 10 feet for that Strike. If there is an unholy ally between Kizrech and their target, or if Kizrech is mounted on an unholy creature, that creature's energy causes the Strike to deal an additional 1d8 spirit damage.

Kizrech (11-12).name: Kizrech (11-12)
Kizrech (11-12).allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

equipment->Charm of Cold Resistance.name: Charm of Cold Resistance

Lesser Marsh Giant.name: Lesser Marsh Giant
Lesser Marsh Giant.publicNotes:
Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants appear hideous to most airbreathers, with fishlike mouths, slimy graygreen skin, and dark, beady eyes. They prefer to eat the flesh of those they slay in battle, including other marsh giants, and guzzle stagnant water from cauldrons or directly from their swampy homes.

Marsh giant clans are insular, with each clan dedicating itself to zealous worship of a sea-dwelling deity, demon lord, or stranger entity. Whatever forces call to the marsh giants sometimes ensnare boggards and ogres as well, gathering in grim worship. Rather than favor these humanoid hangerson, marsh giants lavish attention on favored pets: krooths, giant octopuses, or primeval creatures like dinosaurs and the crocodilian deinosuchuses.

Barely topping 11 feet tall and 1,000 pounds, marsh giants are small for giants but make up for their stature with their zealotry.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They vary widely but are united in their hunger, requiring sustenance of their own element along with the feasts one would expect from such a massive humanoid. Although a simple matter for some giants, more esoteric types find this need a harsh reality. While a massive fistful of ice or snow alongside their meal will satisfy a frost giant, shadow giants hunger for the coagulated shadows of the Netherworld.

action->Drowning Hook.name: Drowning Hook
action->Drowning Hook.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} within the marsh giant's reach

Effect The marsh giant uses its gaff to push the creature down as water bubbles up below it. The target becomes submerged in water until they are no longer prone and must hold their breath if they cannot breathe water. They take @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic] save) and lose 3 rounds worth of air if they fail the save.

action->Twist the Hook.name: Twist the Hook
action->Twist the Hook.description: The marsh giant makes a melee Strike with its gaff. If it hits, it twists and yanks the gaff to knock the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and create an awful wound, dealing @Damage[2d4[persistent,bleed]] damage to the creature.

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements Lyari is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect Lyari devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points. She can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

action->Nihilistic Truthsayer.name: Nihilistic Truthsayer
action->Nihilistic Truthsayer.description: Lyari's solitary time in the depths and unique perspective on existence makes her shockingly accepting of terrible universal truths that others don't want to hear. She calmly lays into an enemy within 30 feet, reminding them of existential frailty, presumed insecurities, and inevitable failures in a logical and level manner. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save. On a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round on a critical failure). Regardless of the result of its save, the target is temporarily immune for 1 hour.

action->Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
action->Swift Leap.description: Lyari jumps up to half her Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements Lyari is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect Lyari devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points. She can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

action->Nihilistic Truthsayer.name: Nihilistic Truthsayer
action->Nihilistic Truthsayer.description: Lyari's solitary time in the depths and unique perspective on existence makes her shockingly accepting of terrible universal truths that others don't want to hear. She calmly lays into an enemy within 30 feet, reminding them of existential frailty, presumed insecurities, and inevitable failures in a logical and level manner. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save. On a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round on a critical failure). Regardless of the result of its save, the target is temporarily immune for 1 hour.

action->Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
action->Swift Leap.description: Lyari jumps up to half her Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Marshy Snapdrake.name: Marshy Snapdrake
Marshy Snapdrake.publicNotes: Skilled kizidhar mages and gardeners handcraft these lovely creatures as much for their shuyookhs' aesthetic pleasure as for their protection. Creating a snapdrake requires first painstakingly constructing a frame of living wood in the shape of a drake before weaving thousands of colorful snapdragon flowers into intricate patterns to form its body and scales. Once complete, snapdrakes often serve kizidhars as a combination of guards, pets, and decorations for as long as they are well fed.

action->Alluring Scent.name: Alluring Scent
action->Alluring Scent.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the snapdrake and must use at least 1 action on its next turn to Stride closer to the snapdrake. On a success, the target is immune to the snapdrake's alluring scent for 1 hour.

action->Greater Marsh Passage.name: Greater Marsh Passage
action->Greater Marsh Passage.description: The marshy snapdrake ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from marshy ground and fungi

action->Marshy Snapdrake Pollen.name: Marshy Snapdrake Pollen
action->Marshy Snapdrake Pollen.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25];

Maximum Duration 8 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus dazzled 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and sickened 1 (2 rounds)

action->Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency 3 times per day

Effect The marshy snapdrake Strides or Flies up to twice its Speed

action->Spray Pollen.name: Spray Pollen
action->Spray Pollen.description: The marshy snapdrake breathes a blast of pollen in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] Creatures caught in the blast must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:25|options:area-effect] save or be exposed to marshy snapdrake pollen The marshy snapdrake can't use Spray Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Spray Pollen]] rounds.

Murderous Crowd.name: Murderous Crowd
Murderous Crowd.descriptionHazard: Concerned citizens shout slogans about the dangers of dealing with Cheliax and throw bricks at Chelaxian sympathizers.
Murderous Crowd.disable: Succeed at two of the following checks in any combination: @Check[athletics|dc:27] (trained) to confiscate dangerous debris, @Check[diplomacy|dc:27] (trained) to calm the crowd, @Check[intimidation|dc:25] (untrained) to scare the crowd away, @Check[will|dc:30] (trained) to maintain a brave and confident demeanor; an effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} that can target an area counts as one automatic success.
Murderous Crowd.routine: (three actions) The unruly crowd uses an action to chant a Catchy Slogan if it is not already benefiting from the effect It uses Shake Confidence once per turn and uses its remaining actions for cobblestone Strikes.
Murderous Crowd.stealth: (trained) Characters automatically detect this hazard when they open the door to the Grand Hall.

action->There They Are!.name: There They Are!
action->There They Are!.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door to the Grand Hall

Effect The unruly crowd rolls Initiative.

action->Catchy Slogan.name: Catchy Slogan
action->Catchy Slogan.description:
All the hazards in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wFpKEx9KSjoVg9xq]{Effect: Catchy Slogan}

action->Shake Confidence.name: Shake Confidence
action->Shake Confidence.description:
The unruly crowd targets a creature within 30 feet The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and immune to Shake Confidence for 24 hours

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature becomes frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Naiad Commander.name: Naiad Commander
Naiad Commander.publicNotes:
The captain is the ultimate authority on a vessel, responsible for the livelihood and well-being of everyone on the ship.

Adventurers may need passage on a swift vessel, or they might face danger from raiders at sea or in coastal settlements.

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals

action->Bravery.name: Bravery
action->Bravery.description: When the naiad commander rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead In addition, anytime they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, reduce its value by 1.

action->Dual Disarm.name: Dual Disarm
action->Dual Disarm.description: The naiad commander makes two Strikes, one with their rapier and one with their main-gauche (in either order) If both Strikes hit, the naiad commander can attempt to [[/act disarm]] the target Their multiple attack penalty increases only after all the attacks are made.

action->No Quarter!.name: No Quarter!
action->No Quarter!.description:
The naiad commander orders their allies to fight without mercy All allied creatures of equal or lower level within 20 feet of the commander gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the naiad commander's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.TjRZbd52qWPjTbNT]{Effect: No Quarter!}

Naiad Raider.name: Naiad Raider
Naiad Raider.publicNotes:
Criminal organizations are always happy to loan out money at exorbitant rates, and their legbreakers are always happy to collect.

In the underbelly of society, the lawless reign supreme.

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

action->Break Legs!.name: Break Legs!
action->Break Legs!.description:
The naiad raider makes a maul Strike against an adjacent creature If it hits, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute As long as this clumsy condition lasts, the creature also takes a –5-foot penalty to its Speeds and has weakness 5 to the naiad raider's Strikes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zOaP4yGwbFOszxeJ]{Effect: Break Legs!}

action->Rushing Strike.name: Rushing Strike
action->Rushing Strike.description: The naiad raider Strides twice If they end their movement within melee reach of an enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.

action->Stampeding Shove.name: Stampeding Shove
action->Stampeding Shove.description: The naiad raider [[/act shove options=stampeding-shove]]{Shoves} a creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their Athletics check if the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the Shove succeeds, the target takes @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] damage (double damage on a critical success).

athletics.label: when Shoving with their aqueous maul

Naiad Ship Hunter.name: Naiad Ship Hunter
Naiad Ship Hunter.publicNotes:
Bounty hunters are constantly on the move, whether within city walls or the wilderness, trailing their fugitive quarries for capture... or disposal. Often relying on stealth or deception as much as martial skill, bounty hunters employ a vast array of talents to accomplish their goals and collect the hefty payout.

Whether they're hired to wage war, protect a caravan, or infiltrate an impenetrable fortress, there's ample work for mercenaries all over Golarion.

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

action->Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
action->Hunt Prey.description: The naiad ship hunter designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking or Gathering Information about, as their prey. The naiad ship hunter gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey, to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey, and to Diplomacy checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.plBGdZhqq5JBl1D8]{Gather Information} about the prey. This effect lasts until they use Hunt Prey again.

action->Posse's Edge.name: Posse's Edge
action->Posse's Edge.description:
The naiad ship hunter and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus on initiative rolls if the opposing side includes their hunted prey.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.m1Vd997DEVoOeaJu]{Effect: Posse's Edge}

action->Precision Edge.name: Precision Edge
action->Precision Edge.description: The frst time the naiad ship hunter hits their hunted prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage.

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: Animal Empathy The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

action->Underwater Awareness.name: Underwater Awareness
action->Underwater Awareness.description:
Trigger An enemy Strikes the naiad warrior while they're underwater

Effect The naiad senses the movement of their enemy in the water and jerks back in time They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack.

action->Dive.name: Dive
action->Dive.description: The naiad warrior moves up to twice their swim Speed downward.

Naiad Water Defender.name: Naiad Water Defender
Naiad Water Defender.publicNotes:
Gang leaders direct cutthroats, killers, thieves, and toughs. The gang leader often appears alongside a bandit gang or other criminals.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone in their way.

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals

action->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
action->Deny Advantage.description: The naiad water defender isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 7th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

action->Evasive Reflexes.name: Evasive Reflexes
action->Evasive Reflexes.description: When the naiad water defender rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger The naiad water defender is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The naiad water defender gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Surprise Attacker.name: Surprise Attacker
action->Surprise Attacker.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the naiad water defender.

action->Brutal Rally.name: Brutal Rally
action->Brutal Rally.description:
Trigger The naiad water defender rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see the naiad water defender gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of the naiad water defender's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}

action->Gang Up.name: Gang Up
action->Gang Up.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the naiad water defender's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the naiad water defender and one of the naiad water defender's allies.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: The naiad water defender Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The naiad water defender deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Naiad Water Guardian.name: Naiad Water Guardian
Naiad Water Guardian.publicNotes:
Believing the ends justify the means, the unsanctioned sheriff is unafraid to use others for their own gain, through bribes, manipulation, or force.

These lone wolves have an aura of mystery, bravado, and swagger.

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

action->At My Command.name: At My Command
action->At My Command.description:
Requirements The naiad water guardian's last action this turn was a successful Strike against a creature within 30 feet

Effect The naiad yells a command at the creature they hit The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or spend the first action on its next turn doing as commanded (or all its actions on its next turn on a critical failure) The naiad can command a creature to approach them, release what its holding, or drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} Regardless of the result of its save, the creature is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

action->Always Ready for a Scufe.name: Always Ready for a Scufe
action->Always Ready for a Scufe.description:
Trigger A creature gets in melee range of the ogre hunter

Effect The ogre hunter draws a melee weapon.

action->Hunting Throw.name: Hunting Throw
action->Hunting Throw.description: The ogre hunter makes a ranged strike with their trident within 60 feet without ranged penalties. If the strike hits, it has enough force to knock the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the trident.

equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of As.name: Silver Religious Symbol of Asmodeus
equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of As.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol can be worn on the body on a chain or pin, or can be held.

action->Sacrifice Minion.name: Sacrifice Minion
action->Sacrifice Minion.description:
Trigger An enemy creature within 15 feet rolls a saving throw

Effect Destroy one imp minion within 15 feet. The enemy rolls twice and takes the lower result on the saving throw.

action->Conjure Imp.name: Conjure Imp
action->Conjure Imp.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect Olinda conjures an imp minion within 20 feet, which can make a melee strike against an adjacent enemy.

equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of As.name: Silver Religious Symbol of Asmodeus
equipment->Silver Religious Symbol of As.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol can be worn on the body on a chain or pin, or can be held.

action->Conjure Imp.description:

action->Slow.description: A partially decomposed rat swarm is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to zombie plague.

action->Zombie Plague.name: Zombie Plague
action->Zombie Plague.description:
The sickened and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} conditions from zombie plague can't end or be reduced until the disease is cured.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:14]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1d4 hours),

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day),

Stage 3 sickened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day),

Stage 4 unconscious (1 day),

Stage 5 dead

Pile of Orts.name: Pile of Orts
Pile of Orts.descriptionHazard: A rift to Hell crackles with unstable energy from the broken summoning circle as a squirming mass of fiends struggles to emerge A blood mist projection of a Hellknight angrily commands them.
Pile of Orts.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:16], @Check[nature|dc:16], @Check[occultism|dc:16], or @Check[religion|dc:16] (2 actions) (trained) while within 15 feet to weaken the rift, dealing @Damage[2d4[spirit]|traits:holy] damage to it. This damage has the holy trait.
Pile of Orts.routine: (1 action) The Hellknight commands the orts, and the trap lashes out at each enemy creature in its space and adjacent, dealing @Damage[(1d6+3)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save) If no enemy is in reach, an ort emerges in an adjacent square.

action->Hellfire.name: Hellfire
action->Hellfire.description: All orts within 30 feet have +1 status bonus to hit and deal 1d4 extra fire damage on a hit.

action->Bubble.name: Bubble
action->Bubble.description:
Trigger The trap receives a critical hit or critically fails a saving throw

Effect One ort emerges adjacent.

action->Planar Breach.name: Planar Breach
action->Planar Breach.description:
Trigger The magic circle is broken

Effect The pile disgorges orts and then rolls initiative

Pirate Goblin.name: Pirate Goblin
Pirate Goblin.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups—especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids typically have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, many are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

action->Tailed Goblin.name: Tailed Goblin
action->Tailed Goblin.description: A pirate goblin is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while Climbing, can Climb with one hand occupied, and can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} opponents even if both hands are occupied.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to the pirate goblin

Effect The pirate goblin Steps.

action->Boarding Action.name: Boarding Action
action->Boarding Action.description: The pirate goblin swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the pirate boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.

Pirate Gorilla.name: Pirate Gorilla
Pirate Gorilla.publicNotes:
Gorillas can be territorial creatures, particularly if provoked by hunters or the presence of more dangerous monsters. A gorilla uses its fangs and powerful arms to bite and pummel trespassers with wild abandon.

While many apes exhibit peaceful or reclusive behavior, gorillas can be territorial, and the megaprimatus is especially aggressive and dangerous.

action->Boarding Action.name: Boarding Action
action->Boarding Action.description: The pirate gorilla swings on a rope or Strides, moving up to double their Speed. If the pirate boarded or disembarked a boat during this movement, they can make a melee Strike at the end of their movement that deals one extra damage die on a hit.

action->Frightening Display.name: Frightening Display
action->Frightening Display.description:
The gorilla beats its chest in a terrifying display. Creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened,inflicts:off-guard] save. While a creature is frightened by this ability, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the gorilla.

Critical Success No effect and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

action->Well-Trained.name: Well-Trained
action->Well-Trained.description: The pirate gorilla is used to taking orders on board the ship. It loses its immunity to linguistic efects, including appeals to surrender.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A partially decomposed rat swarm is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Frenzied Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to zombie plague.

action->Zombie Plague.description:
