Scaling the Chain.name: Scaling the Chain
Scaling the Chain.descriptionHazard: The PCs appear on a gigantic wall of hooked chains dangling in a gray swirling mist. The chains radiate life-chilling energy Cries of innocence and condemnation echo through the mist in Elven. A plane of light 10 feet above eddies and swirls as it dully reflects the PCs below, but the reflections warp and alter the PCs to have sallow complexions like the undead.
Scaling the Chain.disable: A PC that has ascended to the plane of light (@Check[athletics|dc:13] check to Climb; on a critical failure, the PC falls 10 feet before being seized by a chain) can attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:18] check to disrupt the plane or a @Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18] or @Check[religion|dc:18] check to ritually disrupt the haunting. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one. When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled and the PCs all return to area B3.
Scaling the Chain.reset: The haunt resets the next time the Soulshackle traps creatures in the library.
Scaling the Chain.routine: (three actions) The chains rattle and sigh ominously around two different random creatures trapped in the haunt, dealing @Damage[(1d6+2)[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:16|basic] save).

action->The Pain of Devotion.name: The Pain of Devotion
action->The Pain of Devotion.description:
Trigger Hunted by Chains is disabled

Effect The chains rattle ominously, dealing @Damage[(1d6+2)[void]] damage to all creatures in the haunt (@Check[will|dc:16|basic] save). The haunt then rolls initiative.

action->Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
action->Light Vulnerability.description: Attacks against the Leaf of Talhindir are treated as magical if made by a creature who is in magical light or with an object that is in magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell).

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
action->Slink in Shadows.description: The Leaf of Talhindir can [[/act hide]] or end its [[/act sneak]] in a creature's or object's shadow.

action->Weight of Darkness.name: Weight of Darkness
action->Weight of Darkness.description:
Requirements The Leaf of Talhindir made a successful Strike against a living creature with its withered touch on its previous action

Effect The Leaf of Talhindir chains the soul of the creature. They must attempt a @Check[will|dc:17|options:inflicts:enfeebled] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from other Leaves of Talhindir or shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. The enfeebled value from Weight of Darkness decreases by 1 every minute.

Talhindir's Autumn.name: Talhindir's Autumn
Talhindir's Autumn.descriptionHazard: All lights in the room snap on, just as Lyari remembers the day of her death. A susurrus of accusations and a guilty verdict fill the air. Ghostly elven warriors disappear and reappear in a disorienting and implacable advance.
Talhindir's Autumn.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:18] to stand against the force of the verdict, or @Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18], or @Check[religion|dc:18] to ritually disrupt the haunting. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled and the Hunted by Chains haunt triggers.
Talhindir's Autumn.reset: The haunt resets the next time the Soulshackle traps creatures in the library.
Talhindir's Autumn.routine: (two actions) The haunt makes vengeful judgment Strikes against three different random creatures trapped in this haunt. A spectral pool of blood forms beneath any creature knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} by this haunt.

action->Accusations.name: Accusations
action->Accusations.description:
Trigger The PCs all enter the room

Effect Accusations of crimes against the crown are whispered throughout the room in Elven. Each living creature in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:16] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Talhindir's Despair.name: Talhindir's Despair
Talhindir's Despair.descriptionHazard: Gentle crying rises to become overwhelming wails. The fungal carvings begin to weep blood that pools around the pillars
Talhindir's Despair.disable: @Check[performance|dc:20] (trained) to overpower the frightening cries with a greater sound or @Check[occultism|dc:18] or @Check[religion|dc:18] (trained) to ritually disrupt the haunting.
Talhindir's Despair.reset: If the haunt is not dispersed, it resets after 1 day.

action->The Falling Tears.name: The Falling Tears
action->The Falling Tears.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the carving of Viore Ciobanu

Effect Blood begins to rain from the ceiling. The cries from the statues deal @Damage[(2d10+13)[mental]] damage to living creatures within the room (@Check[will|dc:20|basic|options:inflicts:frightened] save). On a failed save, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 minute on a critical failure).

Talhindir's Fall.name: Talhindir's Fall
Talhindir's Fall.descriptionHazard: All lights in the room snap on, just as Lyari remembers the day of her death. A susurrus of accusations and a guilty verdict fill the air. Ghostly elven warriors disappear and reappear in a disorienting and implacable advance.
Talhindir's Fall.disable: @Check[athletics|dc:20] to stand against the force of the verdict, or @Check[arcana|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[religion|dc:20] to ritually disrupt the haunting. Each success reduces the haunt's actions by one When the haunt has no more actions, it is disabled and the Hunted by Chains haunt triggers.
Talhindir's Fall.reset: The haunt resets the next time the Soulshackle traps creatures in the library.
Talhindir's Fall.routine: (two actions) The haunt makes vengeful judgment Strikes against three different random creatures trapped in this haunt. A spectral pool of blood forms beneath any creature knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} by this haunt.

action->Accusations.name: Accusations
action->Accusations.description:
Trigger The PCs all enter the room

Effect Accusations of crimes against the crown are whispered throughout the room in Elven. Each living creature in the room must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Talhindir's Grief.name: Talhindir's Grief
Talhindir's Grief.descriptionHazard: Gentle crying rises to become overwhelming wails. The fungal carvings begin to weep blood that pools around the pillars
Talhindir's Grief.disable: @Check[performance|dc:17] (trained) to overpower the frightening cries with a greater sound or @Check[occultism|dc:15] or @Check[religion|dc:15] (trained) to ritually disrupt the haunting.
Talhindir's Grief.reset: If the haunt is not dispersed, it resets after 1 day.

action->The Falling Tears.name: The Falling Tears
action->The Falling Tears.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the carving of Viore Ciobanu

Effect The fungus statues weep blood, and their cries deal @Damage[(2d6+5)[mental]] damage to living creatures within the room (@Check[will|dc:17|basic|options:inflicts:frightened] save). On a failed save, creatures are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure)

action->Lifesense.name: Lifesense
action->Lifesense.description:
The Scourge senses the vital essence of living creatures within range.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Lifesense]

action->Frightful Presence.name: Frightful Presence
action->Frightful Presence.description:
@Check[will|dc:36]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Note: A radius for this aura was not provided by Paizo

action->Bladed Levitation.name: Bladed Levitation
action->Bladed Levitation.description: The Scourge has a fly speed of 30 feet, but must end its turn within no more than 5 feet off the ground, otherwise it falls and takes damage as normal

action->Final Execution.name: Final Execution
action->Final Execution.description: The scourge targets a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} creature with a blade melee Strike. A successful hit is automatically a critical hit and the target creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. If the target is already doomed, they instead increased their doomed value by 1.

action->Life Sap.name: Life Sap
action->Life Sap.description: A creature damaged by the Scourge's blade Strikes must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}; if the target is already drained, they instead increased their drained value by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3}. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of the Scourge's next turn.

action->To Shreds.name: To Shreds
action->To Shreds.description:
The Scourge explodes into a whirling tornado of metal and blades, at the cost of briefly leaving its warshard core vulnerable. All creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:33] save or take @Damage[10d10[slashing],3d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage. The Scourge can't use To Shreds for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

If the Scourge is targeted by a Reactive Strike as a result of using this action, it takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its AC; if the Reactive Strike disrupts this action, this penalty remains until the start of the Scourge's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.vaqiHzEewOKDx6rP]{Effect: To Shreds (AC Penalty)}

Thoroughbred Nightmare.name: Thoroughbred Nightmare
Thoroughbred Nightmare.publicNotes: Nightmares are flaming equine harbingers of death.

action->Smoke.name: Smoke
action->Smoke.description: 15 feet. The nightmare continually exhales black smoke Creatures within the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to those outside it, and creatures outside the aura are concealed to creatures within it. Nightmares and their riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. It's then temporarily immune to being sickened by the smoke for 1 minute. This is an inhaled poison, and the nightmare and its rider are immune to it.

action->Flaming Gallop.name: Flaming Gallop
action->Flaming Gallop.description: The nightmare Strides or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save to each creature other than the nightmare's rider that the nightmare moves adjacent to during its gallop. Each creature can be affected only once during a single use of Flaming Gallop.

Timonithaea.name: Timonithaea
Timonithaea.publicNotes:
Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered around untouched lakes, massive rivers, or other collective bodies of fresh water. Bards' songs and artists' paintings of these powerful nymphs tend to depict naiad queens in their slightly more humanoid forms, which they don when they make the rare journey into civilized lands to garner allies, gather news, or gauge threats.

Most naiad queens treat those who respect their domains with kindness, but they're fierce—and quick to eliminate foes. Their blinding beauty and breadth of offensive spells make naiad queens fierce opponents if forced into a fight.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Nymph Queens

Nymph queens are powerful nymphs who rule over entire regions of untouched wilderness, not just single trees or ponds. Every variety of nymph can have a queen. Naiad queens are among the most prominent, and more often interact with nearby mortals. Thus, some scholars refer to naiad queens as simply "nymphs."

action->Animal Empathy.name: Animal Empathy
action->Animal Empathy.description: The naiad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals.

action->Tied to the Land.name: Tied to the Land
action->Tied to the Land.description:
Timonithaea is tied to a body of water or area with a great deal of water features.

A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract any spell that would harm the environment (such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD]{Blight} ritual), using her spell DC with a counteract rank equal to the highest-rank druid spell she can cast.

When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.

action->Timonithaea's Calling.name: Timonithaea's Calling
action->Timonithaea's Calling.description: Timonithaea channels magical energy into the Enoménos crown to telepathically communicate with creatures who are beneath the water within 20 miles of Naós tou Neroú.

action->Nymph's Beauty.name: Nymph's Beauty
action->Nymph's Beauty.description:
30 feet @Check[will|dc:23] save.

A creature that fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and becomes stunned 1 each time it starts its turn within the aura for the next 24 hours, even if it can't see Timonithaea.

action->Water Healing.name: Water Healing
action->Water Healing.description: For every 10 minutes a naiad spends soaking in any body of water in her domain, she regains @Damage[30[healing]]{30 Hit Points}.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
Nymph queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium humanoid form, typically choosing a more humanoid-looking version of their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Focus Beauty.name: Focus Beauty
action->Focus Beauty.description:
If a target already affected by nymph's beauty fails its save, the image of the queen sears into the creature's mind, effectively blinding the creature until its vision is restored with sound body or a similar effect.

The naiad queen can Dismiss the effect.

The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target, who must attempt a save against her nymph's beauty aura (@Check[will|dc:23] save). If the creature fails and was already affected by the aura, it takes a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry.

A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.

action->Inspiration.name: Inspiration
action->Inspiration.description:
The nymph queen inspires a single intelligent creature by giving that creature a token of her favor, typically a lock of her hair, though it can be some other significant object as well. As long as the creature carries her token and remains in good standing with her, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to all Crafting checks, Performance checks, and Will saves.

If the nymph grants her token to a bard, and she's the bard's muse, the queen chooses one additional benefit granted by her token: a +1 status bonus to all Lore checks, a +2 status bonus to Performance checks when determining the effects of compositions, a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks, or a +2 status bonus to Will saves against fey.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.iSyyR4QVOaY6mxtg]{Effect: Nymph Queen's Inspiration}

action->Bound Limbs.name: Bound Limbs
action->Bound Limbs.description: A torn trio ordinarily has three severed limbs tethered to a central point by near-incorporeal ropes. A limb is essentially cut away from the central point and rendered nonfunctional each time the torn quartet loses 60 Hit Points (so at 120 Hit Points, the torn quartet has two functional limbs, at 60 Hit Points, it has one functional limb). Each functioning limb can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} separate creatures within reach, or multiple functioning limbs can Grapple the same creature; for each additional limb used to Grapple a creature, the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC increases by 2.

action->Replacement Parts.name: Replacement Parts
action->Replacement Parts.description: A torn trio can spend 1 minute tearing apart the corpse of a humanoid creature that was killed within the last hour to regain 60 Hit Points and restore one of its nonfunctioning limbs. A torn trio can't have more than three limbs.

action->Flurry of Limbs.name: Flurry of Limbs
action->Flurry of Limbs.description: The torn trio makes a number of limb Strikes up to its number of functioning limbs, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the torn trio's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the torn trio makes all its attacks.

action->Split Reactions.name: Split Reactions
action->Split Reactions.description: A torn trio has a number of reactions per round equal to its number of still-functioning limbs, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the torn trio must use a different limb for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the torn trio's limbs is rendered nonfunctional, the torn trio loses one of its reactions.

action->Tear Asunder.name: Tear Asunder
action->Tear Asunder.description:
Requirements The torn trio has a creature grappled or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by at least two limbs

Effect The creature takes @Damage[(5d6+2)[slashing]] damage for each limb currently grabbing or restraining it (maximum 15d6), with a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save. On a critical failure, the creature also loses a random body part, and one of the torn trio's limbs is now no longer grabbing or restraining it.

action->Damned Restoration.name: Damned Restoration
action->Damned Restoration.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect An undead target within reach regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points and gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.F4fWxN5WREaoWz19]{Effect: Damned Restoration}

Unruly Crowd.name: Unruly Crowd
Unruly Crowd.descriptionHazard: Concerned citizens shout slogans about the dangers of dealing with Cheliax and throw bricks at Chelaxian sympathizers.
Unruly Crowd.disable: Succeed at two of the following checks in any combination: @Check[athletics|dc:20] (trained) to confiscate dangerous debris, @Check[diplomacy|dc:20] (trained) to calm the crowd, @Check[intimidation|dc:18] (untrained) to scare the crowd away, @Check[will|dc:22] (trained) to maintain a brave and confident demeanor; an effect such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} that can target an area counts as one automatic success.
Unruly Crowd.routine: (three actions) The unruly crowd uses an action to chant a Catchy Slogan if it is not already benefiting from the effect It uses Shake Confidence once per turn and uses its remaining actions for cobblestone Strikes.
Unruly Crowd.stealth: (trained) Characters automatically detect this hazard when they open the door to the Grand Hall.

action->There They Are!.name: There They Are!
action->There They Are!.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door to the Grand Hall

Effect The unruly crowd rolls Initiative.

action->Catchy Slogan.name: Catchy Slogan
action->Catchy Slogan.description:
All the hazards in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wFpKEx9KSjoVg9xq]{Effect: Catchy Slogan}

action->Shake Confidence.name: Shake Confidence
action->Shake Confidence.description:
The unruly crowd targets a creature within 30 feet The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and immune to Shake Confidence for 24 hours

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature becomes frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

action->Slink in Shadows.description: The Leaf of Talhindir can [[/act hide]] or end its [[/act sneak]] in a creature's or object's shadow.

action->Weight of Darkness.name: Weight of Darkness
action->Weight of Darkness.description:
Requirements The Leaf of Talhindir made a successful Strike against a living creature with its withered touch on its previous action

Effect The Leaf of Talhindir chains the soul of the creature. They must attempt a @Check[will|dc:15|options:inflicts:enfeebled] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from other Leaves of Talhindir or shadows, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4}. The enfeebled value from Weight of Darkness decreases by 1 every minute.
